intro: Cicendiopsis pusilla, commonly known as the small cicendiopsis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Cicendiopsis pusilla is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks.
